original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dmag dpon seng ge 'am /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dmag dpon seng ge 'am /
translated: After preparing the seats and bedding and ringing the gong to ask questions, the monks should be properly informed. When the entire saṅgha is present and in agreement, the general Sīha

original: sbyin bdag des phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag des phyag 'tshal te /
translated: or the benefactor should bow to the saṅgha

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and sit down in front of the senior monk with his palms together. He should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: bdag dmag dpon seng ge dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
analyzed: bdag dmag dpon seng ge dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
translated: I, the general Sīha, am faithful, good, and have virtuous intentions.

original: bdag gis 'di lta ste sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di lta ste sangs rgyas sam /
translated: I have not withheld anything from the Buddha,🔽the Dharma,

original: chos sam ; dge 'dun nam /
analyzed: chos sam ; dge 'dun nam /
translated: the saṅgha,

original: yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am /🔽yongs su ma btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am / yongs su ma btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
translated: or the monks who are pleasing to me.🔽I have given and relinquished everything.

original: bdag gis de ltar phul zhing de ltar yongs su btang bas longs spyod bsrabs shing yongs su bas te /
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar phul zhing de ltar yongs su btang bas longs spyod bsrabs shing yongs su bas te /
translated: Because I have given and relinquished in this way, my wealth has been depleted and exhausted.

original: yongs su mthar thug nas dge 'dun don bzhed pa /🔽phan pa bzhed pas bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba las bdag dmag dpon seng ge yang longs spyod 'phel nas /
analyzed: yongs su mthar thug nas dge 'dun don bzhed pa / phan pa bzhed pas bdag la bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba las bdag dmag dpon seng ge yang longs spyod 'phel nas /
translated: Having fully completed that, he is one who desires the welfare of the Saṅgha.🔽He is one who desires benefit.🔽Having given me the training precepts, I, the general Siṃha, have increased my enjoyments.

original: bdag dmag dpon seng ge bslab pa'i sdom bstsal ba /
analyzed: bdag dmag dpon seng ge bslab pa'i sdom bstsal ba /
translated: I, the general Siṃha, have been given the training precepts.

original: bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par gsol na /
analyzed: bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par gsol na /
translated: I request the destruction of the training precepts.

original: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag @46b la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa stsal du gsol /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag @46b la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa stsal du gsol /
translated: O noble Saṅgha, endowed with compassion, for the sake of compassion, please grant me the destruction of the training precepts.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas na /
translated: In this way, repeat it a second and a third time.

original: de ni bslab pa'i sdom pa'i gzhig pa gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bslab pa'i sdom pa'i gzhig pa gsol ba'o //
translated: That is the request for the destruction of the training precepts.

original: de'i 'og tu dmag dpon seng ge 'am sbyin bdag de thos pa'i nye 'khor nas bkar te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmag dpon seng ge 'am sbyin bdag de thos pa'i nye 'khor nas bkar te /
translated: After that, the general Siṃha or that benefactor is expelled from the vicinity of the hearing.

original: mthong ba'i nye 'khor du bzhag nas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i nye 'khor du bzhag nas /
translated: Having been placed in the vicinity of the sight,

original: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
translated: a single monk should perform the karma of mere request.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It is done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, one should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Listen, Venerable Saṅgha!

original: dmag dpon seng ge 'di dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
analyzed: dmag dpon seng ge 'di dad pa dang ldan zhing bzang la dge ba'i bsam pa can te /
translated: This general Siṃha is faithful, good, and has virtuous thoughts.

original: des sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun nam yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am yongs su ma btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun nam yid du 'thad pa'i dge slong rnams la ma phul ba'am yongs su ma btang ba ci yang ma mchis te /
translated: There is nothing that he has not offered or given away to the Buddha, Dharma, Saṅgha, or pleasing monks.

original: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas longs spyod bsrabs shing yongs su bas te //🔽yongs su mthar thug nas de la dge 'dun don bzhed pa phan pa bzhed pas bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba las /
analyzed: des de ltar phul zhing yongs su btang bas longs spyod bsrabs shing yongs su bas te // yongs su mthar thug nas de la dge 'dun don bzhed pa phan pa bzhed pas bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba las /
translated: By offering and giving in this way, his wealth has been depleted and exhausted.🔽Since the Saṅgha wishes to benefit him, it should grant him the precepts.

original: dmag dpon seng ge de yang longs spyod 'phel te dmag dpon seng ge bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba dge 'dun la sa sdom pa gzhig par gsol na /
analyzed: dmag dpon seng ge de yang longs spyod 'phel te dmag dpon seng ge bslab pa'i sdom pa stsal ba dge 'dun la sa sdom pa gzhig par gsol na /
translated: Moreover, General Siṃha's wealth has increased. If General Siṃha requests the Saṅgha to destroy the precepts that were granted to him,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang dge 'dun gyis dmag dpon seng ge la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par mdzad do//
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang dge 'dun gyis dmag dpon seng ge la bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par mdzad do//
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready, it should give its approval. The Saṅgha is giving the lion, the general, the training rule.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: der dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar kun du spyad pa'i chos ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: der dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar kun du spyad pa'i chos ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There the monks thought, “What are the rules for this?”

original: dge 'dun gyis gang la bslab pa'i sdom pa bshig pa der dge slong rnams kyis 'gor bar bya /🔽stan la longs spyad par bya //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gang la bslab pa'i sdom pa bshig pa der dge slong rnams kyis 'gor bar bya / stan la longs spyad par bya //
translated: “Monks, you should stay in the place where the Saṅgha has given the training rule.🔽You should use the seats there.

original: bsod snyoms blang bar bya /
analyzed: bsod snyoms blang bar bya /
translated: You should receive almsfood there.

original: chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: You should teach the Dharma there.”

original: de ni slob pa la khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa'i cho ga dang las so //🔽de la slob pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni slob pa la khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig pa'i cho ga dang las so // de la slob pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the ritual for the training rule for the householders, and the procedure for giving it.🔽“The training” means

original: slob pa dag ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dag dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag go //
analyzed: slob pa dag ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dag dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag go //
translated: the stream enterers, the once-returners, and the non-returners.

original: khyim pa gang dag ces bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim bdag go //
analyzed: khyim pa gang dag ces bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim bdag go //
translated: Householders means brahmin householders and householder householders.

original: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: The Saṅgha means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata's disciples.

original: bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams par gyur la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las kyis so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams par gyur la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las kyis so //
translated: Bound by the training precepts means by the act of requesting.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas @47a * //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // slob pa dag gi khyim gang dag dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pas @47a * //
translated: If a monk means one of the group of six or anyone similar to them.

original: bsdoms pa de lta bu dag tu zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa lta bu dag tu'o //
analyzed: bsdoms pa de lta bu dag tu zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa lta bu dag tu'o //
translated: Those households of the trainees in which the Saṅgha is bound by the training precepts means those like the ones described.

original: sngar mgron du ma bos par zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis dmag dpon seng ges sngar mgron du bos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa ltar sngar ma bstabs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar mgron du ma bos par zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis dmag dpon seng ges sngar mgron du bos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa ltar sngar ma bstabs pa'o //
translated: “Not previously invited” means that, as stated in the nidāna, the Blessed One gave permission for the venerable Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana to be invited by the general Siṃha first.

original: song ste zhes bya ba ni song nas so //
analyzed: song ste zhes bya ba ni song nas so //
translated: “Having gone” means having gone there.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
translated: “With one’s own hands” means with one’s own hands.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang / bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang / bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: “Food and drink” means the five foods and the five drinks.

original: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs su bcug nas so //
analyzed: blangs nas zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs su bcug nas so //
translated: “Having accepted” means having made the other person give.

original: 'cha' lam za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'cha' lam za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “If one eats” means if one swallows it.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: “That monk” means the monk who is the one who is invited.

original: phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste ;
analyzed: phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste ;
translated: Having gone outside to a public place, he should confess his offense to the monks, saying, ‘Venerable monks, please listen. I have committed an offense that is blameworthy and should be confessed individually. I confess that offense.’

original: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This rule too should be confessed individually.

original: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfall should be understood through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the main part of the downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong sbyin bdag dad pa can longs spyod 'grib pa gang la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i mdun rol du mgron du ma bos pas bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nas ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag ma gtogs
analyzed: dge slong sbyin bdag dad pa can longs spyod 'grib pa gang la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i mdun rol du mgron du ma bos pas bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nas ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag ma gtogs
translated: If a monk who is a faithful benefactor has a diminishing livelihood, then except for the house of a layperson who has given a vow of training in the presence of the Saṅgha, he should not be invited to give a vow of training in the house of a layperson who has not been invited.🔽

original: pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag rang ngam gzhan gang rung bas blangs shing zos na bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin bdag dad pa can longs spyod 'grib pa gang la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag rang ngam gzhan gang rung bas blangs shing zos na bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // sbyin bdag dad pa can longs spyod 'grib pa gang la dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: If a monk, without being invited, eats fresh or cooked food, other than roots, stalks, leaves, flowers, and fruits, that he himself has requested from a faithful householder whose resources are in decline, in front of whom the Saṅgha has given the training on relinquishment, then, whether he himself or someone else takes it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽There is no offense if the Saṅgha has given the training on relinquishment to a faithful householder whose resources are in decline, and if the monk does not disparage the householder.

original: bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i mdun rol du sngar mgron du bos pa'i dge slong gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i mdun rol du sngar mgron du bos pa'i dge slong gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has previously been invited by the householder, and if the monk does not disparage the householder.

original: bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nas blangs shing zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nas blangs shing zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating food that has been received from a household where the precepts of training have been given.

original: ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag @47b ma gtogs pa'i bca' ba rnam pa lnga dang bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i zas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag @47b ma gtogs pa'i bca' ba rnam pa lnga dang bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i zas gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating any of the five types of cooked food or the five types of fresh food, except for garlic, onions, and mushrooms.

original: rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas blangs shing zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas blangs shing zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating food that has been received by oneself or by another.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sngar mgron du ma bos pa dang / dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sngar mgron du ma bos pa dang / dge 'dun gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim nyid do //
translated: The agent of this downfall is either someone who has not been invited to a meal or someone who has received the precepts of training from the saṅgha.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of this downfall is fivefold.

original: khyim pa'i khyim nyid dang / sngar mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang / dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa nyid dang / de'i khyim nas ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gis blangs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: khyim pa'i khyim nyid dang / sngar mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang / dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa nyid dang / de'i khyim nas ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gis blangs pa nyid dang /
translated: The food is in the house of a layperson, not in a monastery, the layperson has not previously invited the monks, the layperson has received the precepts of the Buddhist community, the layperson has personally prepared the food and drink, except for the vegetables, such as eggplant, pumpkin, and radish, which are to be eaten raw.

original: zos pa nyid do //
analyzed: zos pa nyid do //
translated: The five factors are: the householder's house, not having been invited previously, the Sangha having given the vow of training, having taken the food and drink oneself, except for the food and drink of Kakuda, Kaityika, and Nirgrantha, which are not suitable to eat, and having eaten.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors are incomplete, then the downfall is not complete, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a misdeed. It is a misdeed from the time one begins the preparation for the downfall of going to a householder's house, having broken the training, until one has entered the house.

original: dngos gzhil sbyor ba tha dad ba ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhil sbyor ba tha dad ba ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation that is different from the actual basis, there is a misdeed.

original: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu lto 'dun can nyid yin pas de'i phyir ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas gnas skabs thams cad du lto 'dun byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu lto 'dun can nyid yin pas de'i phyir ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas gnas skabs thams cad du lto 'dun byed na nyes byas so //
translated: Since those who violate the precepts and enter the home of laypeople are very greedy for food, this downfall is presented in this way.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a minor offense is also a minor offense, a minor offense of preparation.

original: ltung ba med pa ni de sngar mgron du bos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni de sngar mgron du bos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one is invited there beforehand.

original: ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ga gon dang la phug dang ldam ldum mod pa dag la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one goes to a place where there is a lot of garlic, radish, or onions.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should not at all rely on the training precept of entering a house with split lips in regard to all places and all times.

original: sbyin bdag dad pa can la gal te sbyin pa byin na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag dad pa can la gal te sbyin pa byin na /
translated: If a faithful donor gives a gift to a monk,

original: de phongs par 'gyur ba lta na dge 'dun gyis khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de phongs par 'gyur ba lta na dge 'dun gyis khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and then becomes destitute, the Saṅgha should give a house training precept to that donor.

original: de sbyin pa ni gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis so //
analyzed: de sbyin pa ni gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis so //
translated: That gift is given by a single announcement, not by a formal procedure.

original: sbyin pa de ni sems rtogs nas dge slong gis khyim du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni sems rtogs nas dge slong gis khyim du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: That gift should be given after the monk’s intention has been ascertained.

original: stan la longs spyad @48a * //
analyzed: stan la longs spyad @48a * //
translated: He should sit on a seat.

original: par bya'o // chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: par bya'o // chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: He should teach the Dharma.

original: bsod snyoms blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not accept almsfood.

original: lhung bzed stong pas 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed stong pas 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not enter with an empty begging bowl.

original: de'i byis pa slang ba dag la bca' ba ril por mi sbyin par dum bur byas te sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i byis pa slang ba dag la bca' ba ril por mi sbyin par dum bur byas te sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He should not give whole morsels to the children of that donor, but should give them cut up morsels.

original: ga gon dang la phug la sogs pa 'bras bu dang rtsa ba dag dang ldam ldum la sogs pa tshod ma khyim nas byung ba blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ga gon dang la phug la sogs pa 'bras bu dang rtsa ba dag dang ldam ldum la sogs pa tshod ma khyim nas byung ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should take fruit such as mangoes and eggplants, roots such as radishes and turnips, and vegetables such as mustard greens and so on, from the house.

original: gal te sbyin bdag dad pa can de khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par 'dod pa na bag yangs su bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sbyin bdag dad pa can de khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par 'dod pa na bag yangs su bya'o //
translated: If the faithful patron wishes to destroy the house training, one should relax.

original: de ni dang po sbyin bdag nyid kyi khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyin bdag nyid kyi khyim gyi bslab pa'i sdom pa gzhig par gsol bar bya'o //
translated: First, the patron himself should request the destruction of the house training.

original: de nas dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis de gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis de gzhig par bya'o //
translated: Then the Saṅgha should destroy it with a one-part procedure.

original: der dge slong rnams kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: der dge slong rnams kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should go there.

original: stan la longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: stan la longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: They should use the seats.

original: bsod snyoms blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms blang bar bya'o //
translated: They should receive alms.

original: chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: They should teach the Dharma.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ste gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bslab pa dral te khyim du 'jug pa'i so sor bshags par bya ba ste gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: The confession to be done individually for breaking the training and entering a house has been explained as the third.

original: // / nags brtags pa las gyur ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na ser skya'i gnas kyi gnas su dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: // / nags brtags pa las gyur ba'i so sor bshags par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na ser skya'i gnas kyi gnas su dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: The Introduction to the Confession of the Forest-dwellers: The Blessed Buddha accepted the invitation to spend the rains retreat in the grove of the Kapilas in the village of the Kapilas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyis zhag bdun nam brgyad na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba na spyod yul gyi grong dag tu zhag 'di snyed na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyis zhag bdun nam brgyad na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba na spyod yul gyi grong dag tu zhag 'di snyed na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “When the monks are to perform the invitation ceremony after seven or eight days, they should announce in the villages of the region, ‘The invitation ceremony will be held in so many days.’🔽”

original: dge slong rnams kyis dong ste brjod do //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dong ste brjod do //
translated: The monks went and announced it.

original: de nas ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya dag de nyid kyis dgag dbye bco lnga pa la bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya dag de nyid kyis dgag dbye bco lnga pa la bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the Śākyas living in the village of the Kapilas went to where the Blessed One was on the fifteenth day of the invitation ceremony.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: They bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: They all sat down in one place and the Blessed One taught the Śākyas living in Kapilavastu with a Dharma discourse.🔽He inspired them,🔽enthused them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and delighted them.

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug @48b yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug @48b yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: In many ways he taught them with a Dharma discourse,🔽inspired them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: enthused them, and delighted them, and then remained silent.

original: de nas ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Śākyas living in Kapilavastu, having rejoiced in and delighted in the Blessed One's words, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas sang 'di nyid du bdag cag gi gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas sang 'di nyid du bdag cag gi gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: “Blessed One, please allow us to offer a meal tomorrow to the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: sang dge slong 'gas kyang bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi bgyi ste /
analyzed: sang dge slong 'gas kyang bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi bgyi ste /
translated: No monk should go out for alms tomorrow.

original: bdag cag bsod snyoms 'tshal te mchi zhing bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la rang gi sug pa nas tshim zhing stobs par bgyid do //
analyzed: bdag cag bsod snyoms 'tshal te mchi zhing bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la rang gi sug pa nas tshim zhing stobs par bgyid do //
translated: We will go out for alms and offer to the Blessed One and the community of hearers from our own hands.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ser skya'i gnas na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the Śākyas living in Kapilavastu by remaining silent.

original: de nas de dag gis ser skya'i gnas su dong ste de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa dag sta gon byas nas nang par sngar langs te bca' ba dang bza' ba dag gis shing rta dag bkang nas sh'akya mo rnams la
analyzed: de nas de dag gis ser skya'i gnas su dong ste de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa dag sta gon byas nas nang par sngar langs te bca' ba dang bza' ba dag gis shing rta dag bkang nas sh'akya mo rnams la
translated: Then they went to Kapilavastu, prepared pure and fine food and drink that night, and in the morning, having risen early, filled their carts with food and drink.🔽The Śākya women

original: smras pa / khyed cag shing rta dag zhon la deng shig dang / kho bo cag kyang phyi bzhin 'od ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / khyed cag shing rta dag zhon la deng shig dang / kho bo cag kyang phyi bzhin 'od ngo //
translated: We will follow behind you.

original: de dag rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te shing rta dag la zhon nas 'phags so //
analyzed: de dag rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te shing rta dag la zhon nas 'phags so //
translated: They adorned themselves with all their ornaments, got on the chariots, and left.

original: ser skya'i gnas kyi nye 'khor thibs po yin pas de dag lam gar chom rkun pa dag gis mthong nas chom rkun pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ser skya'i gnas kyi nye 'khor thibs po yin pas de dag lam gar chom rkun pa dag gis mthong nas chom rkun pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Since the area around Kapilavastu was thick with forest, they were seen on the road by some bandits. The bandits said,

original: shes ldan dag sh'akya mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa 'di dag 'dong gis tshur shog gzhom mo //
analyzed: shes ldan dag sh'akya mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa 'di dag 'dong gis tshur shog gzhom mo //
translated: “Sirs, these Śākya women are going adorned with all their ornaments. Come, let’s kill them.”

original: chom rkun pa'i dmag dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: chom rkun pa'i dmag dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The bandit general said,

original: shes ldan dag 'di dag 'dong du zad mod /
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'di dag 'dong du zad mod /
translated: “Sirs, they are just going.

original: khyed cag la 'di dag bcom pas ci bya /
analyzed: khyed cag la 'di dag bcom pas ci bya /
translated: What will you do by killing them?

original: sh'akya gdug pa pha rol gnon pa dag gnon pa byed par 'gyur gyis thong shig /
analyzed: sh'akya gdug pa pha rol gnon pa dag gnon pa byed par 'gyur gyis thong shig /
translated: The evil Śākyas are powerful. They will punish us. Let them go.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: dmag dpon zla ba'i rgyab sus mthong /
analyzed: dmag dpon zla ba'i rgyab sus mthong /
translated: “Who has seen the general Candra pṛṣṭha?

original: gzhom mo zhes de dag gis de'i tshig tshig ma yin par byas te /
analyzed: gzhom mo zhes de dag gis de'i tshig tshig ma yin par byas te /
translated: They said, We will conquer them! and made his words untrue.

original: de dag bcom nas gos dang rgyan thams cad phrogs te dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag bcom nas gos dang rgyan thams cad phrogs te dong ngo //
translated: Having conquered them, they took all their clothes and ornaments and left.

original: sh'akya mo de dag 'jigs shing skrag nas sgren mor tshang tshing dang nags ma de dag gi nang du yib ste 'khod do //
analyzed: sh'akya mo de dag 'jigs shing skrag nas sgren mor tshang tshing dang nags ma de dag gi nang du yib ste 'khod do //
translated: Those Śākya women, frightened and terrified, naked, hid in the thickets and forests and stayed there.

original: shing rta ded pa dag kyang skrag nas byer ro //
analyzed: shing rta ded pa dag kyang skrag nas byer ro //
translated: The ox-cart drivers, frightened, scattered.

original: glang dag kyang chu dag bcad nas ci dgar yan cing 'khod do //🔽shing rta dag kyang shing rta'i mda' @49a * //
analyzed: glang dag kyang chu dag bcad nas ci dgar yan cing 'khod do // shing rta dag kyang shing rta'i mda' @49a * //
translated: The oxen, having cut the ropes, wandered as they pleased.

original: dang bral te 'dug go //
analyzed: dang bral te 'dug go //
translated: The carts, having lost their yokes, remained there.

original: drug sde dag gis phan tshun gros bya bar brtsams nas dga' bo nye dga' sh'akya bag med pa dag yun ring du thogs pas bdag cag gi zan gcad par bya ba'am ci /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis phan tshun gros bya bar brtsams nas dga' bo nye dga' sh'akya bag med pa dag yun ring du thogs pas bdag cag gi zan gcad par bya ba'am ci /
translated: The group of six began to discuss among themselves, saying, Nandaka and Upanandaka, the careless Śākyas, have delayed for a long time. Should we fast or what?

original: bsod snyoms la 'dong ngo //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la 'dong ngo //
translated: Let's go for alms.

original: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te 'phags pa dang / ci tsam na lam ka na shing rta bca' ba dang bza' bas gang ba shing rta'i mda' dang bral ba dag 'dug pa dang glang dag chu dag bcad de ci dgar yan cing 'khod pa dag mthong nas de dag gis phan tshun rnam par bltas nas 'bod par
analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te 'phags pa dang / ci tsam na lam ka na shing rta bca' ba dang bza' bas gang ba shing rta'i mda' dang bral ba dag 'dug pa dang glang dag chu dag bcad de ci dgar yan cing 'khod pa dag mthong nas de dag gis phan tshun rnam par bltas nas 'bod par
translated: On the road they saw carts loaded with food and drink, their oxen unharnessed, and the drivers resting as they pleased.

original: brtsams pa shes ldan dag 'di na su 'khod /🔽de dag gis skad phyung ba dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: brtsams pa shes ldan dag 'di na su 'khod / de dag gis skad phyung ba dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: They looked at each other and said, Sirs, who is here?

original: khyed cag su yin /
analyzed: khyed cag su yin /
translated: The others shouted, and the group of six said, Who are you?

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag sh'akya mo dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag sh'akya mo dag go //
translated: They said, Noble ones, we are Śākya women.

original: tshur sheg kho bo cag la brims shig /'phags pa dag bdag cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom ste sgren mor mchis so //
analyzed: tshur sheg kho bo cag la brims shig /'phags pa dag bdag cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom ste sgren mor mchis so //
translated: Come, give it to us.  Noble ones, we were robbed by thieves and are naked.

original: kho bo cag gdugs tshod yol gyis tshur sheg / khyed cag gi yan lag dang nying lag dag las kho bo cag gis sngon ma mthong ba gang yod tshur shag de dag lo ma dag gis g-yogs te byung nas brims par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: kho bo cag gdugs tshod yol gyis tshur sheg / khyed cag gi yan lag dang nying lag dag las kho bo cag gis sngon ma mthong ba gang yod tshur shag de dag lo ma dag gis g-yogs te byung nas brims par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“Nandaka, Upanandaka, look, look!

original: dga' bo nye dga' ltos shig ltos shig / sh'akya mo 'di dag gi mig ci 'dra /🔽sna ci 'dra /🔽mchu ci 'dra /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ltos shig ltos shig / sh'akya mo 'di dag gi mig ci 'dra / sna ci 'dra / mchu ci 'dra /
translated: What are the eyes of these Śākya women like?🔽What are their noses like?

original: nu ma ci 'dra /🔽lag pa ci 'dra /
analyzed: nu ma ci 'dra / lag pa ci 'dra /
translated: What are their lips like?🔽What are their breasts like?🔽What are their hands like?

original: rked pa ci 'dra /
analyzed: rked pa ci 'dra /
translated: What are their waists like?🔽What are their legs like?”

original: rkang pa ci 'dra ba ltos shig / de dag de ltar rtses pa na ngo tsha nas tshang tshing dang nags ma de dag nyid kyi nang du yib ste song ngo //
analyzed: rkang pa ci 'dra ba ltos shig / de dag de ltar rtses pa na ngo tsha nas tshang tshing dang nags ma de dag nyid kyi nang du yib ste song ngo //
translated: As they were teasing them like this, the Śākya women became embarrassed and hid among the trees and bushes.

original: bsel ba rnams kyis sh'akya rnams la sh'akya mo rnams bcom mo zhes sbran pa dang / de nas sh'akya dag mnga' gzhu lag na thogs shing mtshon gzas pa dag gis lam kar dong ste /
analyzed: bsel ba rnams kyis sh'akya rnams la sh'akya mo rnams bcom mo zhes sbran pa dang / de nas sh'akya dag mnga' gzhu lag na thogs shing mtshon gzas pa dag gis lam kar dong ste /
translated: Then the Śākyas, armed with bows and arrows, went out to the road.

original: lam bgags nas de dag gis chom rkun pa de dag bzung ngo //
analyzed: lam bgags nas de dag gis chom rkun pa de dag bzung ngo //
translated: They blocked the road and captured the bandits.

original: de na kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: de na kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some of them said,

original: 'di dag la btang snyoms byar ci yod /
analyzed: 'di dag la btang snyoms byar ci yod /
translated: “What is there to be indifferent about?🔽Let’s kill them!”

original: gsad do // kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: gsad do // kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some said,

original: re zhig deng khrid la sh'akya mo rnams la dris la bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig deng khrid la sh'akya mo rnams la dris la bya'o //
translated: “Let’s take them to the Śākya women and ask them what to do.”

original: de dag gis de dag khrid nas sh'akya mo rnams kyi gan du dong ste dres pa dang / sh'akya mo rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis de dag khrid nas sh'akya mo rnams kyi gan du dong ste dres pa dang / sh'akya mo rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They took them to the Śākya women and asked them. The Śākya women said,

original: chom rkun pa'i dmag dpon 'di ni nyes pa med pa gnod pa mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chom rkun pa'i dmag dpon 'di ni nyes pa med pa gnod pa mi byed pa yin te /
translated: “This leader of the bandits is innocent and does no harm.

original: 'dis de dag @49b bzlog na de dag ma btub pas 'di ni thong shig //
analyzed: 'dis de dag @49b bzlog na de dag ma btub pas 'di ni thong shig //
translated: He turned them back, but they were not subdued. Let him go.”

original: de dag gis de btang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis de btang ngo //
translated: They let him go.

original: de srog de'u chad pa las phyir thob nas des de dag gi rkang pa la gtugs te smras pa /
analyzed: de srog de'u chad pa las phyir thob nas des de dag gi rkang pa la gtugs te smras pa /
translated: When they regained consciousness, they fell at the feet of the Śākyas and said,

original: shes ldan dag khyed cag dad pa skyes te /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed cag dad pa skyes te /
translated: “Sirs, you have developed faith

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol du 'gro ba yin na 'di dag bsad pas khyed la ci bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol du 'gro ba yin na 'di dag bsad pas khyed la ci bya /
translated: and are going to offer a meal to the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks, so why did you kill these people?

original: nyes pa byed pa 'di dag kyang gtang bar gsol /
analyzed: nyes pa byed pa 'di dag kyang gtang bar gsol /
translated: Please release these criminals.”

original: de dag gis de dag las bcom pa'i rdzas dag phyir bkug ste btang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis de dag las bcom pa'i rdzas dag phyir bkug ste btang ngo //
translated: They took back the stolen goods and released them.

original: de nas sh'akya de dag gis sh'akya mo de dag la gos bskon cing rgyan thogs su bcug nas shing rta dag kyang chu dag la btags te /
analyzed: de nas sh'akya de dag gis sh'akya mo de dag la gos bskon cing rgyan thogs su bcug nas shing rta dag kyang chu dag la btags te /
translated: Then the Śākyas dressed the Śākya women in clothes and adorned them with ornaments, and they loaded the carriages with water.

original: shing rta la zhon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar dong ngo //
analyzed: shing rta la zhon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar dong ngo //
translated: They mounted the carriages and went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs pa dang / sh'akya dang sh'akya mo rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la brims par brtsams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs pa dang / sh'akya dang sh'akya mo rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la brims par brtsams so //
translated: The Blessed One took his place on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks, and the Śākyas and Śākya women began to serve the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks.

original: sh'akya mo rnams drug sde dag la zas sbyin nas sh'akya rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sh'akya mo rnams drug sde dag la zas sbyin nas sh'akya rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The Śākya women gave food to the group of six, and the Śākyas said,

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa dag la zhal zas mi gsol /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa dag la zhal zas mi gsol / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Why don’t you serve food to the noble ones?”🔽“

original: 'di dag gis zos zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis zos zin to //
translated: They’ve already eaten,” they replied.🔽“🔽Where?”🔽“

original: gang du gsol de nyid du'o //
analyzed: gang du gsol de nyid du'o //
translated: Right here.”🔽“🔽Who served it?”

original: sus brims kho bo cag gis so //
analyzed: sus brims kho bo cag gis so //
translated: Who is it that distributes them? We do.

original: khyed cag sgren mo dag gis ji ltar brims /
analyzed: khyed cag sgren mo dag gis ji ltar brims /
translated: How could you serve it when you were naked?”🔽“

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gis kho mo cag la mtho btsams /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gis kho mo cag la mtho btsams /
translated: They’re so conceited!”

original: ji ltar / kho mo cag lo ma dag gis g-yogs te tshang tshing dang nags ma dag gi nang nas byung ste brims par brtsams pa dang 'di dag gis mtho btsams te 'di ltar brjod par bya ba mang du yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar / kho mo cag lo ma dag gis g-yogs te tshang tshing dang nags ma dag gi nang nas byung ste brims par brtsams pa dang 'di dag gis mtho btsams te 'di ltar brjod par bya ba mang du yod do //
translated: “We were covered by leaves and emerged from the thickets and forests, and began to distribute the food. They saw us and said, ‘There is a lot to be said about this.

original: de ni 'jal gyis 'di dag ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de ni 'jal gyis 'di dag ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin gyis /
translated: They are indulging in negative tendencies,

original: 'di dag la zas mi sbyin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la zas mi sbyin no //
translated: so we will not give them any food.’

original: de dag cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
analyzed: de dag cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
translated: They sat there in silence.

original: de nas de dag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun brims nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun brims nas smras pa /
translated: “Then, after they had distributed the food to the community of monks, they said,

original: 'phags pa dag kye ma khyed kyi lam 'di 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag kye ma khyed kyi lam 'di 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: ‘Noble ones, you said, “Oh, this path of yours is dangerous,”🔽and we were careful as we went along.’

original: bdag cag bag bgyid cing mchi ba zhig na zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag cag bag bgyid cing mchi ba zhig na zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, the Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, you should not distribute the food to the community of monks first and then to the nuns.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis dge slong nags nyul ba chos lnga dang ldan pa spro bar byas te gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis @50a * //🔽bsko bar bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis dge slong nags nyul ba chos lnga dang ldan pa spro bar byas te gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis @50a * // bsko bar bya zhing /
translated: “Therefore, monks, you should encourage a monk who is a forest-dweller and who has five qualities to request the ceremony for the appointment of a monk who is a forest-dweller, and you should appoint him through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

original: dge slong nags nyul ba'i kun du spyod pa'i chos dag kyang yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong nags nyul ba'i kun du spyod pa'i chos dag kyang yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: And you should take up the rules of conduct for a monk who is a forest-dweller.

original: 'di ltar byas te dge slong nags nyul ba chos lnga dang mi ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya /🔽bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas te dge slong nags nyul ba chos lnga dang mi ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya / bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: A monk who is a forest-dweller and who does not have five qualities should not be appointed, and if he has been appointed, he should be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / nags nyul ba dang ma nyul ba mi shes pa'o //🔽nags nyul ba chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / nags nyul ba dang ma nyul ba mi shes pa'o // nags nyul ba chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
translated: Going because of desire, going because of ill will, going because of confusion, going because of fear, and not knowing what is and is not a forest.

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: A monk who is a forest-dweller and who has five qualities should be appointed, and if he has been appointed, he should not be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / nags nyul ba dang ma nyul ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / nags nyul ba dang ma nyul ba shes pa'o //
translated: not going out of desire, not going out of hatred, not going out of delusion, not going out of fear, and knowing whether or not the forest has been searched.

original: 'di ltar bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be done.

original: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
translated: First, one should encourage them.

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro 'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro 'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Are you, named so-and-so, able to search the Saṅgha’s forest?”

original: gal te spro na des spro bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te spro na des spro bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If they say, “I am able,” they should say, “I am able.”

original: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: After that, having prepared the bedding, having rung the gong, having announced to the monks with the words of inquiry,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //🔽'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o // 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is seated and has reached agreement, a monk should make a proposal and perform the procedure.🔽It should be done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting, one should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro na /🔽gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnad par mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar bsgo ste /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro na / gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnad par mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar bsgo ste /
translated: If the saṅgha approves of this monk so-and-so being the forest ranger,🔽then let the saṅgha listen to this. The saṅgha is appointing the monk so-and-so as the forest ranger.

original: dge slong nags nyul ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong nags nyul ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul ba'o //
translated: The monk so-and-so is the forest ranger.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /🔽dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro na /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul bar spro na /
translated: “Virtuous ones, listen!🔽This monk so-and-so is eager to be the forest ranger.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bskos te /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bskos te /
translated: Therefore, the saṅgha is appointing the monk so-and-so as the forest ranger.

original: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul ba na tshe dang ldan pa gang dag @50b ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de ni gsungs shig //
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul ba na tshe dang ldan pa gang dag @50b ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de ni gsungs shig //
translated: Those who do not accept it should speak.

original: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bskos lags pas ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul te //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nags nyul bar bskos lags pas ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi nags nyul te //
translated: The saṅgha has accepted and agreed to appoint the monk so-and-so as the forest-dweller. The monk so-and-so is the forest-dweller of the saṅgha.

original: de ltar cang ma gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar cang ma gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there is no objection, this is held to be so.

original: de ni dge slong nags nyul ba spro bar bya ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsgo ba'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni dge slong nags nyul ba spro bar bya ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsgo ba'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the rite and the procedure for appointing a forest-dweller with a proposal and a single proclamation, and for encouraging the forest-dweller.

original: dge slong nags nyul ba'i kun du spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong nags nyul ba'i kun du spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The monk who is the forest-dweller should act in the following way.

original: dge slong nags nyul bas dpag tshad phyed nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dge slong nags nyul bas dpag tshad phyed nas bzung ste /
translated: The monk who is the forest-dweller should stay at least half a league away🔽from the other monks.

original: kho ra khor yug tu nags nyul bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho ra khor yug tu nags nyul bar bya'o //
translated: He should search for a forest all around.

original: gal te 'dod na khye'u sus sbyin par bya zhing grogs kyang bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod na khye'u sus sbyin par bya zhing grogs kyang bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: If he likes it, he should ask for it and make it his own.

original: gal ta nags 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na des dud brda gtul bar bya /
analyzed: gal ta nags 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na des dud brda gtul bar bya /
translated: If the forest is dangerous, he should set up a signal fire.

original: ba dan sngon po bsgreng bar bya /
analyzed: ba dan sngon po bsgreng bar bya /
translated: He should hoist a blue flag.

original: 'dab ma'i chang bu dag lam kar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i chang bu dag lam kar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should place a sign on the path.

original: gal te nags 'jigs pa med pa nyid yin na ba dan dkar po bsgreng bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nags 'jigs pa med pa nyid yin na ba dan dkar po bsgreng bar bya'o //
translated: If the forest is safe, he should hoist a white flag.

original: dge slong nags nyul bas kun du spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong nags nyul bas kun du spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who is searching for a forest does not act in accordance with the rules for proper conduct, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag nags sngar ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dad bza' ba blangs te 'cha' zhing za zhes smod par byed phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag nags sngar ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dad bza' ba blangs te 'cha' zhing za zhes smod par byed phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: Some monks who had few concerns complained and criticized him, “Why do the monks eat the food that has been offered to the Sangha outside the monastery without searching for a forest?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this event as the basis and this event as the reason, assembled the community of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the group of six did this?”

original: dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “Monks, this is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the training,🔽it is not in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable for disciples,🔽and it is not allowable for you.🔽This is not something that should be done by those gone forth.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: Having rebuked them in many ways, the Blessed One instructed the monks,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I see no benefit in establishing a rule of training for my disciples, but I see a great deal of harm.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dgon pa gang dag dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa /🔽'jigs pa dang bcas par @51a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dgon pa gang dag dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa /🔽'jigs pa dang bcas par @51a * //
translated: Monks, there are some solitary places that are known to be dangerous and frightening,

original: grags pa / 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags par gyur la /
analyzed: grags pa / 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags par gyur la /
translated: and it is well known that it is frightening because of the various dangers.

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dgon pa gang dag dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dgon pa gang dag dogs pa dang bcas par grags pa /
translated: If a monk, in such a place, takes food or provisions outside the monastery without first informing the saṅgha,

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa /🔽'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa de lta bu dag tu sngar ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te 'cha' 'am zan dge slong de phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste🔽dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas par grags pa / 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa de lta bu dag tu sngar ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te 'cha' 'am zan dge slong de phyi rol kun dga' ra bar song ste dge slong rnams la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la smad pa'i gnas mi rigs pa so sor bshags par bya ba byung gis chos de so sor 'chags so zhes so sor bshags par bya ste /
translated: then, having gone outside the monastery,🔽he should confess his mistake to the other monks, saying, ‘Venerables, I have committed an act of censure, an act that should be confessed. I confess this fault.’

original: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: chos 'di yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: This is the rule.

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
translated: The place was Kapilavastu.

original: gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The individuals involved were six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bdag nyid 'gengs shing dge 'dun gyi don yal bar 'dor ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bdag nyid 'gengs shing dge 'dun gyi don yal bar 'dor ba /
translated: The affliction is filling oneself and neglecting the welfare of the community.

original: nyes pa ni nags ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni nags ma nyul bar kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te za ba'o //
translated: The offense is taking and eating food outside the monastery without searching for a place in the wilderness.

original: de la dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: In this case, “of the community” means of the community of disciples of the Tathagata.

original: gnas mal dgon pa gang dag ces bya ba la dgon pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab drug la rdul phra mo gcig go / rdul phra mo drug la chu rdul gcig go //🔽chu rdul drug la lcags rdul gcig go //
analyzed: gnas mal dgon pa gang dag ces bya ba la dgon pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab drug la rdul phra mo gcig go / rdul phra mo drug la chu rdul gcig go // chu rdul drug la lcags rdul gcig go //
translated: “Wilderness” means a place where there are no atoms, no particles, no water particles, no iron particles, no rabbit particles, no sheep particles, no cow particles, no sunbeam particles, no sesame seeds, no mustard seeds, no barley seeds, and no finger joints.🔽Six atoms make one particle.🔽Six particles make one water particle.

original: lcags rdul drug la ri bong gi rdul gcig go //🔽ri bong gi rdul drug la lug rdul gcig go //
analyzed: lcags rdul drug la ri bong gi rdul gcig go // ri bong gi rdul drug la lug rdul gcig go //
translated: Six water particles make one iron particle.🔽Six iron particles make one rabbit particle.🔽Six rabbit particles make one sheep particle.

original: lug rdul drug la glang rdul gcig go //🔽glang rdul drug la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //
analyzed: lug rdul drug la glang rdul gcig go // glang rdul drug la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //
translated: Six sheep particles make one cow particle.🔽Six cow particles make one sunbeam particle.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul drug la sro ma gcig go //
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul drug la sro ma gcig go //
translated: Six sunbeam particles make one sesame seed.

original: sro ma drug la shig gcig go //
analyzed: sro ma drug la shig gcig go //
translated: Six sesame seeds make one mustard seed.🔽Six mustard seeds make one barley seed.🔽Six barley seeds make one finger joint.

original: shig drug la nas gcig go //🔽nas drug la sor gcig go //
analyzed: shig drug la nas gcig go // nas drug la sor gcig go //
translated: Six lice eggs make one barley grain.

original: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo //🔽khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
analyzed: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo // khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
translated: Six barley grains make one finger joint.🔽Four finger joints make one finger.🔽Four finger widths make one width.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
translated: Four widths make one cubit.

original: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig go //
analyzed: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig go //
translated: Five hundred cubits make one krośa.🔽One krośa is the distance a cowherd can cover in the time it takes to drink milk, eat, and rest his cows.
