analyzed: ci 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di /
translated: “Is this pure to the venerable ones?”

original: ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya ba rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya ba rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
translated: “Since the venerable ones are silent, they agree.” This is the proclamation of the arrangement of the confession.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya ba'i chos bzhi po bton pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni so sor bshags par bya ba'i chos bzhi po bton pa de la'o //
translated: Here refers to the four dharmas that are to be confessed.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba gdon pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba gdon pa bshad zin to /
translated: The recitation of the dharmas to be confessed has been explained.🔽The Compendium of Discourses on Monastic Discipline,

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa /🔽bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel ba 'dul ba kun las btus pa / bam po bzhi bcu gsum pa /
translated: a commentary on the Sutra on Monastic Discipline,

original: da ni bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the recitation of the many dharmas of training should be explained.

original: de'i phyir sdom la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdom la /
translated: Therefore, in summary:🔽There are seven on the lower robe,🔽three on the upper robe,

original: sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // stod g-yogs la yang rnam gsum dang // shin tu bsdams la sogs pa lnga //
analyzed: sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // stod g-yogs la yang rnam gsum dang // shin tu bsdams la sogs pa lnga //
translated: and five on being very restrained,🔽and so on.

original: mgo g-yogs la sogs rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mgo g-yogs la sogs rnam pa lnga //
translated: There are five on covering the head,🔽and so on.

original: mchong la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mchong la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
translated: There are five on jumping,🔽and so on.🔽There are five on the body,

original: lus la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
translated: and so on.🔽There are nine on sitting,

original: 'dug par bya ba dgu dag dang // byin len bya ba brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: 'dug par bya ba dgu dag dang // byin len bya ba brgyad rnams so //
translated: and eight on receiving.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: sdom la nyes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang // dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la nyes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang // dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The purpose of the words of the training rules is as before.

original: sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gong ma gnyis la bslab pa'i chos bzhi bcu rtsa bdun yod pa rnams kyis go rims bzhin du 'og nas gzhung nyid las ston to //
analyzed: sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gong ma gnyis la bslab pa'i chos bzhi bcu rtsa bdun yod pa rnams kyis go rims bzhin du 'og nas gzhung nyid las ston to //
translated: The two verses of the synopsis beginning “Seven on the lower robe” indicate the forty-seven rules of training that are taught in the text below in order.🔽Venerables, these many rules of training are to be recited every half month from the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bslab pa'i chos mang po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i chos mang po gdon pa'i lung 'bogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bslab pa'i chos mang po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i chos mang po gdon pa'i lung 'bogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the transmission of the recitation of the many rules of training.

original: bslab pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su mthun par bslab pa'i chos des de dag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su mthun par bslab pa'i chos des de dag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “points of training” means that which is not in conflict with the Vinaya and is in accord with the morality of the way of renunciation that is not in conflict with the world. Those points of training are called “Dharma” because they hold their own characteristics.

original: mang po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i chos brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'og nas byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: mang po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i chos brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'og nas byung ba dag ste /
translated: The phrase “these many” refers to the one hundred and twelve points of training that will be explained below.

original: 'di dag la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become downfalls?

original: spyir bstan pa ni 'dir @53b yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir bstan pa ni 'dir @53b yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: In general, the characteristics of these points of training should be understood through the presentation of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the points of training, and the restoration of downfalls.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di dag las 'das na dngos gzhi la ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di dag las 'das na dngos gzhi la ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the downfalls that are the main part are established as follows: if one transgresses these, one commits a downfall that is to be confessed in the main part.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas te /
translated: The downfalls of preparation are misdeeds that are to be restrained.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: They are minor transgressions.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni de bas kyang na smad de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni de bas kyang na smad de /
translated: The downfalls of preparation of preparation are even more reprehensible.

original: bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: They become minor misdeeds that are to be restrained.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bslab par bya ba las ma 'das pa dang las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bslab par bya ba las ma 'das pa dang las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for those who do not transgress the precepts, for beginners, for those who are insane, for those whose minds are disturbed, and for those who are overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa'i chos rnams las 'gal bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya bya ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su mthun par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa'i chos rnams las 'gal bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya bya ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su mthun par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The amendment is that one must train in a way that is consistent with the ethics of renunciation, which is not in conflict with the Vinaya or with the world.

original: phyir bcos pa ni ji ltar ltung byed kyi ltung ba bsdams pa dang / mi bca' ba dang / gang zag gcig la mthol ba dang / bshags pa'i rim gyis dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya ba dang /
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni ji ltar ltung byed kyi ltung ba bsdams pa dang / mi bca' ba dang / gang zag gcig la mthol ba dang / bshags pa'i rim gyis dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya ba dang /
translated: Just as the downfalls of the class of partial defeats are amended by the process of acknowledging them to a single person, confessing them, and so forth, so too the downfalls of the class of offenses that require confession are amended by the process of acknowledging them to a single person, confessing them, and so forth.

original: dngos gzhi'i nyes byas ni bshags par bya la /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i nyes byas ni bshags par bya la /
translated: The faults of the class of offenses of wrong conduct are amended by confession alone.

original: sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas ni yid kyis bsdam par bya ba'i tshul sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas ni yid kyis bsdam par bya ba'i tshul sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The misdeed of the preparation of a preparation is to be understood as the method of restraining the mind as previously explained.🔽Every half month, it arises from the recitation of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation. This means that every half month, it arises from the recitation of the Vinaya by the one who holds the Vinaya.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sbyong gdon pa'i tshe 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i kha ton las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar stan to //
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sbyong gdon pa'i tshe 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i kha ton las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar stan to //
translated: The Sūtra of the Collection of the Precepts states:🔽There are seven rules for the lower robe.🔽The Sūtra of the Collection of the Precepts states:

original: sngom la / sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // zhes gsungs pa'i bslab pa bsdu ba'i mdo ni sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya /
analyzed: sngom la / sham thabs la ni rnam bdun dang // zhes gsungs pa'i bslab pa bsdu ba'i mdo ni sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya /
translated: You should train in wearing the lower robe evenly.

original: sham thabs ha cang rtsengs ba ma yin pa dang / ha cang 'jol ba ma yin pa dang / glang po che'i sna ltar ma yin pa dang / ta la'i lo ma ltar bltab pa ma yin pa dang / 'bru'i phur ma ltar ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sham thabs ha cang rtsengs ba ma yin pa dang / ha cang 'jol ba ma yin pa dang / glang po che'i sna ltar ma yin pa dang / ta la'i lo ma ltar bltab pa ma yin pa dang / 'bru'i phur ma ltar ma yin pa dang /
translated: You should train in not wearing the lower robe too high, not wearing it too low, not wearing it like an elephant’s trunk, not wearing it like a palm leaf, not wearing it like a grain container,

original: sbrul mgo'i gdengs @54a * //
analyzed: sbrul mgo'i gdengs @54a * //
translated: not wearing it like a snake’s hood,🔽and not wearing it like a tree branch.

original: ka ltar ma yin par bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: ka ltar ma yin par bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba dag yin no //
translated: One should not wear the lower robe like a bird’s wings.

original: de la sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the precept to wear the lower robe in a way that is not like a bird’s wings is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das w'a r'a na s'i na drang srong smra ba ri dags kyi nags na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das w'a r'a na s'i na drang srong smra ba ri dags kyi nags na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana in Vārāṇasī.🔽When the Blessed One established the five ascetics in the state of a monk by having them enter the faultless state, they wore the lower robe like householders because of their previous practice.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga pa dag skyon med pa la 'jug pas dge slong nyid la bkod pa de'i tshe na de dag sngon goms pa'i sbyor bas sham thabs khyim pa bzhin du gyon par byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga pa dag skyon med pa la 'jug pas dge slong nyid la bkod pa de'i tshe na de dag sngon goms pa'i sbyor bas sham thabs khyim pa bzhin du gyon par byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag
translated: Faithful brahmins and householders

original: gis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: gis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: saw them and said,🔽“Noble ones, why do you wear the lower robe like householders?”

original: 'phags pa dag ji ltar khyed sham thabs gsol ba 'di ltar nor can dag dang / tshong dpon dag dang / ded dpon dag 'tshal bar bgyid do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dag dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ji ltar khyed sham thabs gsol ba 'di ltar nor can dag dang / tshong dpon dag dang / ded dpon dag 'tshal bar bgyid do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dag dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One thought,🔽“What the householders say is true. I will think about how the hearers of the past perfect buddhas wore their lower robes.”

original: khyim pa dag zer ba bden gyis ngas sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyan thos dag sham thabs ji ltar gyon par gyur pa bsam mo snyam du dgongs pa dang / lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: khyim pa dag zer ba bden gyis ngas sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyan thos dag sham thabs ji ltar gyon par gyur pa bsam mo snyam du dgongs pa dang / lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
translated: The gods requested the Blessed One,

original: bcun pa 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bcun pa 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Respected One, it is just like the gods of the pure abodes.”

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams lta bur mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams lta bur mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa byung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One himself came to know and see just like the gods of the pure abodes.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: de lta bas na nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Therefore, my disciples, you should recite this training rule:

original: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘We train by wearing the sarong evenly.’

original: yul ni b'a r'a na s'i /
analyzed: yul ni b'a r'a na s'i /
translated: The place was in Vārāṇasī.

original: gnag zag ni lnga po dag /
analyzed: gnag zag ni lnga po dag /
translated: The defiled ones were the five.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas sngon goms pa'i sbyor ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas sngon goms pa'i sbyor ba /
translated: The affliction was the habitual application of past training.

original: nyes pa ni sham thabs khyim pa bzhin du gyon pa'o //🔽'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba bstan pa la dgag pa'i tshul gyis 'di dang 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan tam /
analyzed: nyes pa ni sham thabs khyim pa bzhin du gyon pa'o // 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba bstan pa la dgag pa'i tshul gyis 'di dang 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan tam /
translated: The misdeed was wearing the sarong like a householder.

original: sgrub pa'i tshul gyis 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan ce na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshul gyis 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan ce na /
translated: Here, in the teaching of the actual downfall, is it taught by way of negation, saying, “This and this should not be done,” or is it taught by way of affirmation, saying, “This and this should be done”?

original: sgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by way of affirmation.

original: sham thabs ci nas kyang zlum por 'dug par gyur pa de ltar bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta @54b bur bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bstan to //
analyzed: sham thabs ci nas kyang zlum por 'dug par gyur pa de ltar bgo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta @54b bur bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bstan to //
translated: One should train in wearing the lower robe in such a way that it is always round.

original: de la sham thabs zlum po zhes bya ba ni mtha'i dang kha mnyam par 'dug pa des /
analyzed: de la sham thabs zlum po zhes bya ba ni mtha'i dang kha mnyam par 'dug pa des /
translated: There, the lower robe is round when the ends are even.

original: sham thabs ji nas kyang zlum por 'dug par 'gyur bde ltar bgo bar bslab bar bya'o //
analyzed: sham thabs ji nas kyang zlum por 'dug par 'gyur bde ltar bgo bar bslab bar bya'o //
translated: One should train in wearing the lower robe in such a way that it is always round.

original: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya ba 'di ni mdor bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bslab par bya ba 'di ni mdor bstan pa yin la /
translated: This is the brief presentation of the training in wearing the lower robe in a round way.

original: 'og nas sham thabs ha cang rtsengs pa ma yin par bgo bar bslab par bya ba la sogs pa drug 'byung ba dag ni 'di'i spros pa yin gyis rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas sham thabs ha cang rtsengs pa ma yin par bgo bar bslab par bya ba la sogs pa drug 'byung ba dag ni 'di'i spros pa yin gyis rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The six that follow, such as one should train in wearing the lower robe without making it too full, are its elaboration, not a presentation of other aspects.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood by way of the downfalls, the preparations, the preparations for the preparations, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendings.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the downfalls are presented as follows: If one does not act in accordance with the trainings in the context of the actual practice, then that is the actual downfall that must be confessed.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sham thabs rung ba dang tshad dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sham thabs rung ba dang tshad dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is one who has a suitable lower robe and one who has the right size.

original: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
translated: There is one branch:

original: dngos gzhi'i bsgrub pa nyid dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i bsgrub pa nyid dag la ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i bsgrub pa nyid dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i bsgrub pa nyid dag la ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: The actual practice, the preparations, and the preparations for the preparations are all censured as appropriate.

original: ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams ni gong du spyir bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams ni gong du spyir bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendings are as explained above in the general presentation.

original: bslab pa 'og ma thams cad la yang dngos gzhi dang / byed pa po dang yan lag dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa dag 'di bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bslab pa 'og ma thams cad la yang dngos gzhi dang / byed pa po dang yan lag dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa dag 'di bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas de stan de nyid la gya tshom du 'dug pa dang / nang mi brtad pa dang bcas pa dang 'phags pa khye'u khye'u zhes smras pa dang / de myur ba myur bar langs nas ci tsam na de dag gis de dus la bab par mthong nas de dag du bar brtsams pa dang /
translated: Because arhats do not see or know without reflection, he sat down on the seat without thinking. When the family saw him, they said, “Noble one, the child, the child.” He quickly got up. When they saw that he was leaving, they began to cry.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽“What is the matter?”

original: sring mo dag 'di la ci 'dud /
analyzed: sring mo dag 'di la ci 'dud /
translated: “Sisters, what is this?”

original: 'du byed thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: “This is the nature of all conditioned things.”

original: 'on kyang kho bo la brten te bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar 'gyur bas 'di la kho bo 'dud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang kho bo la brten te bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar 'gyur bas 'di la kho bo 'dud par bya ba yin no //
translated: “But since I am the one who has brought the Blessed One to the Vinaya, the basis of training for the hearers will be established. I will bow to him.”

original: 'khor ba na sems can rnams nye du @70b la byams pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa yin pas de dag de bzhin du ngu zhing mi sdod pa thos nas dge slong rnams kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba na sems can rnams nye du @70b la byams pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa yin pas de dag de bzhin du ngu zhing mi sdod pa thos nas dge slong rnams kyis skabs de bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang /
translated: Since beings in saṃsāra have been accustomed to loving their relatives since beginningless time, when they heard that they were crying and not staying, the monks asked the Blessed One about this situation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Therefore, my hearers, the basis of training in the Vinaya should be recited like this:

original: stan la ma brtags par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par mi bya bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: stan la ma brtags par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par mi bya bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘One should not sit on a seat in another’s house without examining the seat. One should train in this way.’

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka /
translated: The person is the Venerable Udayin.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pa /
translated: The affliction is the non-purification of the latent tendencies, so that one does not engage in knowledge and insight without reflection.

original: nyes pa ni stan la ma brtags par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni stan la ma brtags par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o //
translated: The offense is sitting on a seat in another's house without examining the seat.

original: de la stan la ma brtags pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gzhan der stan la ma brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de la stan la ma brtags pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gzhan der stan la ma brtags pa ste /
translated: Here, not examining the seat means not examining the seat in that other's house.

original: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par mi bya bar bslab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par mi bya bar bslab par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one should train in not sitting on a seat in another's house.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the establishment of the basic transgression is that if one does not act in accordance with the training in the basic situation, it becomes the basic misdeed to be confessed.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni ma brtags par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni ma brtags par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the agent is the one who acts without examining.

original: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
translated: Here, there is one branch:

original: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: The establishment of the basic act.

original: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The application and the application of the application are condemned in the same way as above.

original: bslab pa sum cu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa sum cu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-second instruction.

original: // / lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The instruction on not sitting down heavily on a seat in another’s house

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Nyagrodha Park in Kapilavastu.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das mngon par byung nas lo bcu gnyis lon zhing rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das mngon par byung nas lo bcu gnyis lon zhing rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had gone forth and twelve years had passed since his perfect awakening,

original: lo drug lon nas ser skya'i gnas su byon pa de'i tshe nyi ma gcig na yab kyi thad du gdugs tshod gsol /
analyzed: lo drug lon nas ser skya'i gnas su byon pa de'i tshe nyi ma gcig na yab kyi thad du gdugs tshod gsol /
translated: six years had passed since he had come to Kapilavastu. One day he accepted a meal from his father.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa la ni rang gi btsun mo'i 'khor du gdugs tshod gsol ba na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas btsun mo grags 'dzin ma bshos 'dri ma gsol zer ba la rkang pas rkang pa la phul ba dang / de stobs dang ldan pas ma 'gyel nas /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa la ni rang gi btsun mo'i 'khor du gdugs tshod gsol ba na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas btsun mo grags 'dzin ma bshos 'dri ma gsol zer ba la rkang pas rkang pa la phul ba dang / de stobs dang ldan pas ma 'gyel nas /
translated: On the second day, when the king was having his midday meal in the harem, the venerable Udayi said to Yasodhara, “I have been sent to get some food.” He put his foot on her foot.🔽She was strong and did not fall down.

original: des btsun mo sa 'tsho ma la smras pa /🔽sa 'tsho ma 'phags pa 'char kas bdag sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun @71a * //
analyzed: des btsun mo sa 'tsho ma la smras pa / sa 'tsho ma 'phags pa 'char kas bdag sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun @71a * //
translated: She said to Queen Gopa,

original: gyi spyan sngar mtho btsams so //
analyzed: gyi spyan sngar mtho btsams so //
translated: “Gopa, the noble Udayi has insulted me in the presence of the Buddha and the community of monks.

original: ci byas des ji ltar gyur pa brjod pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: ci byas des ji ltar gyur pa brjod pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: What did he do?” She told her what had happened.

original: de ci nas kyang phyin chad de lta byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mi dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ci nas kyang phyin chad de lta byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mi dga' bar bya'o //
translated: She said, “I will do something to make him not do that again.”

original: ci tsam nyi ma gzhan zhig la btsun mo grags 'dzin gyis khri'u ma brgyus pa zhig ras kyis g-yogs nas bu mo mdag gzhug ma tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bram ze'i ming gis 'bod du btang ba dang / des bsam pa /
analyzed: ci tsam nyi ma gzhan zhig la btsun mo grags 'dzin gyis khri'u ma brgyus pa zhig ras kyis g-yogs nas bu mo mdag gzhug ma tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bram ze'i ming gis 'bod du btang ba dang / des bsam pa /
translated: He thought,🔽“I will go there and give the gift as before.”

original: der gong ma chag par sbyin pa byed kyis 'gro'o snyam nas de myur ba myur bar song ste smras pa /
analyzed: der gong ma chag par sbyin pa byed kyis 'gro'o snyam nas de myur ba myur bar song ste smras pa /
translated: He quickly went there and said,

original: je slong mo pa dag la ci zhag sbyin par bya ba de lta'o //
analyzed: je slong mo pa dag la ci zhag sbyin par bya ba de lta'o //
translated: “What is to be given to the beggars?”

original: grags 'dzin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: grags 'dzin gyis smras pa /
translated: Yaśodharā said,

original: 'phags pa zho'i kham por 'di dang phye'i kham phor 'di 'greng ste long la khri'u 'di la bzhugs shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa zho'i kham por 'di dang phye'i kham phor 'di 'greng ste long la khri'u 'di la bzhugs shig /
translated: “Noble one, take this bowl of yogurt and this bowl of flour, stand up, and sit on this bench.”

original: ci khri'u 'di yang kho bo la sbyin nas 'phags pa khri'u ni mi gsol lo //
analyzed: ci khri'u 'di yang kho bo la sbyin nas 'phags pa khri'u ni mi gsol lo //
translated: “Should I also give this bench to you? Noble one, you don’t need a bench.”

original: des bsams pa gal te khri'u mi ster na khri'u 'di yang ba cag par bya'o snyam nas des zho'i kham phor dang phye'i kham phor de gnyis 'greng ste blangs nas khri'u de nyid la lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste 'dug par brtsams pa dang khri'u zhig
analyzed: des bsams pa gal te khri'u mi ster na khri'u 'di yang ba cag par bya'o snyam nas des zho'i kham phor dang phye'i kham phor de gnyis 'greng ste blangs nas khri'u de nyid la lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste 'dug par brtsams pa dang khri'u zhig
translated: He thought, “If I don’t get a cot, I’ll just make this cot light.” He took the two bowls of yogurt and flour, stood up, and started to sit down on the cot, putting his whole body weight on it. The cot broke.

original: ste sgyel nas zho'i kham phor dang phye'i kham phor de de'i mgor bo ba dang / de dag gis rta gad kyis btab ste lag pa dang rkang pa dag nas bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing bur 'phangs so //
analyzed: ste sgyel nas zho'i kham phor dang phye'i kham phor de de'i mgor bo ba dang / de dag gis rta gad kyis btab ste lag pa dang rkang pa dag nas bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing bur 'phangs so //
translated: The two bowls of yogurt and flour fell on his head, and they all laughed. They grabbed his arms and legs and threw him into the Bodhisattva’s pleasure pond.

original: de langs te gos dag 'chir ba dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de langs te gos dag 'chir ba dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: When he got out and put on his robes, the monks saw him and said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka 'di ci nyes /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka 'di ci nyes /
translated: “Venerable Udayī, what happened to you?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: kho bos ku re cung zhig byas nas nyes dmigs 'di lta bu 'di byung ngo //
analyzed: kho bos ku re cung zhig byas nas nyes dmigs 'di lta bu 'di byung ngo //
translated: “I was just joking around a little bit, and this is the problem that arose.”

original: de dag smod par byed phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de dag smod par byed phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They disparaged him and ridiculed him.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: When the monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, the Blessed One thought,🔽“They are reviled in their own homes.”

original: de dag gnas su smod do snyam nas snga ma bzhin du lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de dag gnas su smod do snyam nas snga ma bzhin du lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab par khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: As in the previous, “One should not sit down heavily in someone else’s house. One should train in this.”

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
translated: The place was Kapilavastu.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka /
translated: The person was the venerable Udāyī.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
translated: The affliction was disrespect.

original: nyes pa ni lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o //🔽de lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab ces @71b bya ba'i khyim gzhan der stan la gya tshom du lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste thrig ces 'dug par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o // de lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis mi dbab ces @71b bya ba'i khyim gzhan der stan la gya tshom du lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis phab ste thrig ces 'dug par mi bya ba ste /
translated: The offense was sitting down heavily in someone else’s house.🔽“One should not sit down heavily in someone else’s house” means that one should not sit down heavily in someone else’s house without restraint.

original: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in this.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the basic transgression is defined as the basic misdeed that is to be confessed when one does not practice the training in the basic situation.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis 'bebs pa dang 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni lus thams cad kyi ljid kyis 'bebs pa dang 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is the one who descends and sits down with the weight of the whole body.

original: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
translated: Here, there is one branch:

original: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: The basic accomplishment itself.

original: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rags par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rags par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the accomplishment of the preparation and the preparation of the preparation, as much as is appropriate, it is said to be reprehensible, as before.

original: bslab pa sum cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa sum cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-third training.

original: // / rkang pa mi bsnol bar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / rkang pa mi bsnol bar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The setting for the training in not sitting on a seat in another's house with crossed legs is that the Blessed Buddha was staying in the Nyagrodha grove in Kapilavastu.

original: drug sde dag gis khyim gzhan du rkang pa bsnol te 'dug par byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis mthong nas smod par byed de /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis khyim gzhan du rkang pa bsnol te 'dug par byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis mthong nas smod par byed de /
translated: Faithful brahmins and householders saw them and criticized them,

original: 'phags pa dag /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag /
translated: “Noble ones,

original: dva dag dang rgyan po pa dag dang / nal gyi bu dag 'di ltar mchis pas 'di ni tshul dang mthun pa ma lags kyis 'di ltar ma bzhugs shig /
analyzed: dva dag dang rgyan po pa dag dang / nal gyi bu dag 'di ltar mchis pas 'di ni tshul dang mthun pa ma lags kyis 'di ltar ma bzhugs shig /
translated: this is not proper. You should not sit like this, like a pair of lovers, gamblers, or bastards.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: shes ldan dag 'di la dgos pa yod do //
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'di la dgos pa yod do //
translated: “Sirs, there is a reason for this.”

original: 'phags pa dag dgos pa gang lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag dgos pa gang lags /
translated: “Noble ones, what is the reason?”

original: je dang por khyed cag nyid mi shes pa dang bral ba dang bslabs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: je dang por khyed cag nyid mi shes pa dang bral ba dang bslabs par gyur pa'o //
translated: “First, you must be free of ignorance and train.”

original: de dag rgya cher smod pa la zhugs pa thos nas skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: de dag rgya cher smod pa la zhugs pa thos nas skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: When they heard the extensive criticism, the monks reported the matter to the Blessed One. The Blessed One thought,🔽“I will allow the monks to sit with their legs crossed in other people’s houses.”

original: khyim pa dag zer ba bden no snyam nas snga ma bzhin du rkang pa mi bsnol bar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: khyim pa dag zer ba bden no snyam nas snga ma bzhin du rkang pa mi bsnol bar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: The householder said, It is true, and the Blessed One thought, It is true, and he established a rule: One should not sit on a seat in another's house with crossed legs, as before. One should train in sitting on a seat in another's house without crossing the legs.

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
translated: The place was Kapilavastu.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The affliction was not in accordance with proper conduct.

original: nyes pa ni rkang pa bsnol te khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni rkang pa bsnol te khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug pa'o //
translated: The fault was sitting on a seat in another's house with crossed legs.

original: de la rkang pa mi bsnol ba zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa gzhag ste 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la rkang pa mi bsnol ba zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa gzhag ste 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: In that case, not crossing the legs means one should not sit with one leg placed on top of the other.

original: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos @72a * //
analyzed: de ltar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'o // de la 'dir dngos @72a * //
translated: Thus one should train in sitting on a seat in another's house.

original: gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su bslab pa de ltar ma byas na bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the establishment of the actual basis means that if one does not practice the training in the actual basis, it becomes the actual basis of a fault to be confessed.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rkang ba bsnol ba dang 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rkang ba bsnol ba dang 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is crossing the legs and sitting.

original: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
translated: Here, there is one branch:

original: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: The practice of the main part.

original: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the practice of the preparation and the practice of the practice of the preparation, it is said that one should not do anything improper, as before.

original: bslab pa sum cu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa sum cu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-fourth instruction.

original: // / brla mi bsnol bar khyim gzhan du stan la 'dug par bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /

translated: The agent of this is the destruction of the one who is established as similar to a stupa, and the food itself.

original: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni gcig ste /
translated: Here, there is one branch:

original: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i sgrub pa nyid do //

original: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i sgrub pa nyid dag la ni ci rigs par na smad do zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the practice of the preparation and the practice of the practice of the preparation, the word condemned is applied as appropriate, as before.

original: legs par zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba man cad 'di yan cad thams cad ni grong dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa gnas skabs thams cad du legs par zas bza' bar bslab par bya ba de'i spros pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: legs par zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba man cad 'di yan cad thams cad ni grong dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa gnas skabs thams cad du legs par zas bza' bar bslab par bya ba de'i spros pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: One should train in eating food well and so on, all of this up to here, is to be applied as the elaboration of that training in eating food well in all circumstances, such as in the village, monastery, and so on.

original: bslab pa drug cu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa drug cu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the sixty-eighth training rule.

original: // / sdom la /
analyzed: // / sdom la /
translated: The summary:

analyzed: 'phya la sogs pa rnam ba bzhi //

original: lhung bzed la yang rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: lhung bzed la yang rnam pa bcu //

analyzed: 'greng bar byed la sogs pa lnga // mgo g-yogs la sogs rnam pa lnga //

analyzed: do ker can la sogs pa lnga //

original: glang chen la sogs zhon pa lnga //
analyzed: glang chen la sogs zhon pa lnga //

analyzed: lag na dbyug pa la sogs drug //

original: na ba rnam pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: na ba rnam pa bzhi rnams so //

original: zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The summary is as before in terms of the meaning of the words and the purpose.

original: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bslab pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan pa dag kyang 'og nas gzhung nyid las go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bslab pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bstan pa dag kyang 'og nas gzhung nyid las go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: The forty-four trainings taught by these summary verses are shown below in the text itself in order.

original: sdom la / 'phya ba la sogs rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: sdom la / 'phya ba la sogs rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The summary verse says: The four are: mocking, etc.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i bslab pa bsdu ba'i mdo ni drung na 'dug ba'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i bslab pa bsdu ba'i mdo ni drung na 'dug ba'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya /
translated: The summary sutra on the training taught is: One should train to not look at the begging bowl of a monk sitting nearby in order to mock him.

original: lag pa zas dang 'bags pas chu snod la mi gzung bar bslab par bya /🔽drung na 'dug pa'i dge @88a * //🔽slong la zas dang 'bags pa'i chus mi gtor bar bslab par bya /
analyzed: lag pa zas dang 'bags pas chu snod la mi gzung bar bslab par bya / drung na 'dug pa'i dge @88a * // slong la zas dang 'bags pa'i chus mi gtor bar bslab par bya /
translated: Do not hold a water vessel with a hand soiled by food.🔽Do not splash water on a fellow monk sitting nearby.

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma dris par chu zas dang 'bags pa khyim gzhan du mi dbo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma dris par chu zas dang 'bags pa khyim gzhan du mi dbo bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Do not throw water soiled by food into another’s house without asking permission.

original: de la drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis for the precept not to look at a fellow monk’s alms bowl with the intention of criticizing it is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: drug sde dag khyim gzhan du zas zab na de dag gi drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong mang du za ba dag dang / drug sde dag 'phyas 'dogs shing /
analyzed: drug sde dag khyim gzhan du zas zab na de dag gi drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong mang du za ba dag dang / drug sde dag 'phyas 'dogs shing /
translated: When the group-of-six ate in other people’s houses, they criticized the many who ate in the presence of the monks.

original: dga' bo nye dga' rgan zhugs 'di mang po 'di snyed za ba la ltos zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' rgan zhugs 'di mang po 'di snyed za ba la ltos zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta bar bslab par bya'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: When the monks told the Blessed One about this, he said, “Monks, you should not look at the alms bowls of monks sitting nearby in order to criticize them.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The people were the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'phyas smod kyi nyes rtsom /🔽nyes pa ni dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir blta ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'phyas smod kyi nyes rtsom / nyes pa ni dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir blta ba'o //
translated: The affliction was the fault of criticizing and disparaging.🔽The fault was looking at the alms bowls of monks in order to criticize them.

original: de la drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta ba zhes bya ba ni gang la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir blta ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir lta ba ste /
analyzed: de la drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir mi blta ba zhes bya ba ni gang la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir blta ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir lta ba ste /
translated: “Monks, you should not look at the alms bowls of monks sitting nearby in order to criticize them” means that if you have the attitude of looking in order to criticize, then that is looking in order to criticize.

original: de ltar 'phyas smod kyi nyes rtsom mi bya bar bslab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'phyas smod kyi nyes rtsom mi bya bar bslab par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one should train in not committing the fault of disparaging.
